alert.note: Alert for Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 11 at 2:27PM PDT until August 14 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 605, 607, AND 660... The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from late Saturday night through Monday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 605 North Oregon Cascade Foothills and Fire Weather Zone 607 Mt. Hood National Forest West of Cascade Crest. In Washington, Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills. * WINDS...East wind 5 to 15 mph with periods of 10 to 20 mph, particularly at night and during the morning hours across ridgetops. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...20 to 30%. * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid fire spread which may threaten life and property. Use extra caution with potential ignition sources, especially in grassy areas. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest easterly winds will most likely occur late Saturday night into Sunday morning and then again Sunday night into Monday morning.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills
